result.execSummary:
The defendant Micah J Sterling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

May Terminate Probation after 6 months if demed appropriate. No Violent contact with victim. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micah J Sterling

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Micah J Sterling in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he wishes to proceed pro se.  Court advises Defendant of his right to counsel.  Court performs colloquy with Defendant regarding his waiver of right to an attorney.  Defendant still wishes to proceed pro se.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

45 DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR      **may terminate early - after 6 months, if deemed appropriate**     TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No violent contact with:  victim

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any family members including Alvis Sterling.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Micah J Sterling in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.
